page.title: 16DIALECT. SOUTH SHROPSHIRE.
page.content: {The dialect}of the area is colourful and pleasant to hear. It is mainly heard among the older generation who have lived here all their lives and it seems to be particularly pronounced in the male voice. {Examples:- }"It were white-over this morning, but it inna too cold now. By middle-day I shouldna be surprised if it's raining. This daggly weather- ooh it dunna please the bees." "D'ye know, down the lane where my lad live, it's a whole topcoat warmer." "You hanna tasted tea from our water have ye? We allus use the well water for driking" "I inna gunna cos I dunna wanna" {Rucks}(a lot of anything){a clout} (coat) {am ya?}(are you){ship}(sheep) {watter}(water){suck}(sweets){fittle (food){bonk}(bank/hill).
